content:
Roasting bell peppers and zucchini is a fantastic way to bring out their natural sweetness and pair them with your grilled chicken breast.

**Simple Roasted Bell Peppers and Zucchini Recipe:**

Ingredients:

* 2 bell peppers (any color), seeded and sliced into 1-inch pieces
* 2 medium zucchinis, sliced into 1/2-inch thick rounds
* 2 tbsp olive oil
* Salt and pepper to taste
* Optional: garlic powder, paprika, or other herbs of your choice

Instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a bowl, toss the bell pepper and zucchini slices with olive oil, salt, and pepper until they're evenly coated.
3. If desired, add garlic powder, paprika, or other herbs and toss to combine.
4. Spread the vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. Roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly caramelized, flipping them halfway through.

**Time Estimate:**

Roasting the vegetables will take around 20-25 minutes, but you'll need to factor in some prep time as well. Here's a rough breakdown:

* Prep time: 10 minutes (chopping the veggies, tossing with oil and seasonings)
* Roasting time: 20-25 minutes
* Total time: 30-35 minutes

To ensure you have enough time to cook and eat dinner before watching your episode of "The Office" and getting to bed on time, I recommend starting to prep the vegetables around 8:30 PM. This should give you enough time to roast them, grill your chicken breast, and enjoy your dinner before settling in for your TV time.

Feel free to adjust the cooking time based on your oven and the tenderness you prefer for your vegetables. Enjoy your delicious and healthy dinner!
